intro: Wahlenbergia flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Wahlenbergia flaccida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
